You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
NONPROFIT CLOUD
Set Up Nonprofit Cloud

Set up Salesforce Nonprofit Cloud that includes sales and service innovations and features to manage your nonprofit operations.

NOTE Salesforce offers Nonprofit Cloud, which includes integrated platform solutions for Fundraising, Program Management, Case Management, and Grantmaking. This content provides information about these solutions. Find the managed package documentation in Salesforce for Nonprofits. If you’re not sure which version your organization uses, check with your Salesforce admin.
Set Up Salesforce Basics for Nonprofit Cloud
Turn on and configure Salesforce features to use with Nonprofit Cloud.
Turn on the Basics for Fundraising
Turn on Salesforce features that enhance Fundraising features.
Turn on the Basics for Program and Case Management
Turn on Salesforce features that enhance Program and Case Management features.
Turn On Nonprofit Cloud Features
Turn on features included in Nonprofit Cloud.
Set Up Salesforce Basics for Nonprofit Cloud

Turn on and configure Salesforce features to use with Nonprofit Cloud.

Enable Person Accounts.
From Setup, in the Quick Find box, enter Program and Case Management. In Program and Case Management, enable these settings:
Select Group Membership Settings, and enable Create and manage households and groups.
Select Interaction Summary Settings, and enable Capture and share client interaction summaries in an efficient and compliant manner.
Set Up Group Membership.
Turn on the Basics for Fundraising

Turn on Salesforce features that enhance Fundraising features.

Assign the Fundraising_Admin Permission Set Group to the admin user performing Fundraising setup.
To define tasks needed to complete a business process, set up Action Plans.
From Setup, in the Quick Find box, enter Action, and then under Guided Setup, select Action Plans.
To configure Action Plans, follow the guided setup.

For detailed configuration steps, see Action Plans in Salesforce.

To segment similar stakeholder profiles, set up Actionable Segmentation.
From Setup, in the Quick Find box, enter Actionable, and then under Guided Setup, select Actionable Segmentation.
To configure Actionable Segmentation, follow the guided setup

For detailed configuration steps, see Enable Actionable Segmentation.

To use Data Processing Engine, set up Data Pipelines.
To let users add custom tags to stakeholder records, set up Interest Tags.

Users with the Fundraising_Admin or Fundraising_User permission set group can use Interest Tags on Accounts (including Person Accounts) and Campaigns.

To take and store detailed notes of meetings and conversations, set up Interaction Summaries.
From Setup, in the Quick Find box, enter Interaction, and then under Guided Setup, select Interaction Summaries.
To configure Interaction Summaries, follow the guided setup.

For detailed configuration steps, see Interaction Summaries.

To get an at-a-glance view of your customers' life events or milestone, set up Life Events.
From Setup, in the Quick Find box, enter Life, and then under Guided Setup, select Life Events.
To configure Life Events, follow the guided setup.

For detailed configuration steps, see Events and Milestones.

To help users decide what needs attention now or soon, set up Record Alert.
To see key events relating to a person, turn on Timeline. Configure Timeline in the Setup and Configure Fundraising steps.
Turn on the Basics for Program and Case Management

Turn on Salesforce features that enhance Program and Case Management features.

Assign permission sets for Program Management, Case Management, and other features you're using.
To view stakeholder relationships in an easy-to-navigate graph, set up Actionable Relationship Center (ARC).
From Setup, in the Quick Find box, enter Actionable, and then under Guided Setup, select Actionable Relationship Center.
Follow the guided help to configure the Actionable Relationship Center.

For detailed configuration steps, see Actionable Relationship Center (ARC).

To add actions in the Action Launcher Lightning web component, set up Action Launcher.
To use Data Processing Engine, set up Data Pipelines.
To define tasks needed to complete a business process, set up Action Plans.
From Setup, in the Quick Find box, enter Action, and then under Guided Setup, select Action Plans.
Follow the guided setup to configure Action Plans.

For detailed configuration steps, see Action Plans in Salesforce.

To automate the processing of records in scheduled flows, set up Batch Management.
To use Dynamic Assessments, Configure Dynamic Assessments .
To take and store detailed notes of meetings and conversations, set up Interaction Summaries.
From Setup, in the Quick Find box, enter Interaction, and then under Guided Setup, select Interaction Summaries.
Follow the guided help to configure Interaction Summaries.

For detailed configuration steps, see Interaction Summaries.

To set up OmniStudio automation, install or upgrade the OmniStudio Package.
To see key events relating to a person, set up Timeline.
Turn On Nonprofit Cloud Features

Turn on features included in Nonprofit Cloud.

Set Up Fundraising.
Set Up Program Management.
Set Up Case Management.
Set up Outcome Management with Nonprofit Cloud.
If you have Nonprofit Cloud for Grantmaking, set up Nonprofit Cloud for Grantmaking.
DID THIS ARTICLE SOLVE YOUR ISSUE?
Let us know so we can improve!
Yes
No
